thread.title: ‘The Seminarian’ Review: The Man Who Would Be King

author: Jonathan Eig
title: ‘The Seminarian’ Review: The Man Who Would Be King
text:
Every basketballteam has one—the player who hates to pass, preferring to launch a shot every time he touches the ball. At Crozer Seminary in 1951, that player was Martin Luther King Jr., known to his classmates as ML, or Mike, or “a will-shoot.” When asked why he disdained the passing game, the 21-year-old King merely shrugged. “I just felt like shooting,” he said, according to a friend.
It is a testament to Patrick Parr, an independent scholar and freelance journalist, that he learned about King’s style on the basketball...
